topic.title: Has any ID provider designed for anti multiple accounts?
topic.body:
Obviously multiple accounts is the base of spamming:
Spammers can bypass my mute list

topic.title: The most shitty issues ever
topic.body:
These are my occurred:
- [can't delete your GitHub issues, even you are the owner](https://github.com/isaacs/github/issues/253)
- [can't delete your Google Drive activity log](https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/drive/9GdJUW52Q58)
- [In Excel, scroll cell snap to edge](https://excel.uservoice.com/forums/304921-excel-for-windows-desktop-application/suggestions/9769824-have-excel-scroll-better-when-there-are-large-cell)
- [border-collapsed table borders have inconsistent widths when device pixel scale is not 1](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=895096)

Why most shitty? These issues so easy to resolve, but no action for years.
Have anymore?

topic.title: [Freenet] vs [ZeroNet via I2P], which have stronger anonymity?
topic.body:
- Freenet: anonymous data storage (have its own network)
- ZeroNet: data storage (use clearnet or TOR so far, [I2P coming soon](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/45))
- I2P: anonymous network

All three are P2P and distributed.

*For many reasons, TOR is not be compared.*

topic.title: Why ZeroNet choose Bitcoin crypto, not PGP?
topic.body: As I know, ZeroNet don't use Bitcoin transaction. Any reason to touch (part of) Bitcoin tech?

topic.title: What happen if one username have multi identity address?
topic.body:
Example: [KaffieID](/id.kaffie.bit)

How to count space quota?
All address share same quota, or each address have separately quota?

topic.title: When will ZeroNet support I2P?
topic.body:
China's network blockade are increasing, lots of proxy software are down, but I2P is still tough.
I want this feature be supported sooner.

topic.title: How to set <iframe> [src] as ZeroNet-site?

As far I test, it can't.

I want to make a ZeroNet-Disqus.

topic.title: Identity Proof of Work
topic.body:
Generate a vanity address that contain specified prefix.

Proof of Work is not strong as CAPTCHA, but not need centralized server.

Idea from: /Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/18fLf6bqfzvGLvMA2DrEmDxiqvnAWyN6dv/1508131752

topic.title: Nofish, it is time to take action for Chinese posts.
topic.body:
If you set ZeroNet GUI in English, you will see:
> + Start new topic
> Please use English, you can reach other language forums at the top of this page

If you set ZeroNet GUI in Chinese, you will see:
> + 创建新话题
> 请使用英语，或者你可以在页面顶部到达其他语言的论坛

---

You write these, you have to do these.

topic.body: ZeroNet Namecoin-based DNS works well, why not ID provider?

topic.title: Advanced Usage: Immutable Content, Trusted Timestamp, Permission Control
topic.body:
1. I don't allow user to edit post content after he posted
2. I don't allow user fake time timestamp
3. I want assign someone as admin to manage part of site, not whole site

How do these in ZeroNet?
I am afraid file-based can't do these, ZeroNet should be (database) row-based.

topic.title: Is it possible to run site without <iframe> wrapper?
topic.body: I guess that wrapper is for anti CSRF.

topic.title: Why limit file kind in ZeroUp?
topic.body: > Only mp4, webm, tar.gz, zip files allowed on this site

topic.title: As site owner, how to force delete one user data?
Disallow site owner overlay user data
topic.body: Now [site owner can overlay user data](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1511948137_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6), but I promise I won't edit user data, I want to commit this in mechanism level **forever** (peers should not receive user data signed by site owner), how to do this?

topic.title: Backup for Everyone
topic.body:
Everyone should backup its data, but someone have not, so I do this (real-time backup, currently powered by Vice Versa + VVEngine).
From now on, I keep everyone's main data last 100 versions and last 90 days.

Prerequisites:
- The site you used are seeding by me (most of popular sites)
- Your file name is `data.json` (the main data of many sites)
- You are not [muted by me](https://gist.github.com/anonymous/9cee135c3212ca47d4c234c2d014ad60)

If you want get your backup, please comment on this post.

---

More: [Archive System](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1211)

> [nekololi](#comment_41_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): Multiple accounts is a good starting point for having anonymity and not having all of your online activity linked back to a single ID...

Sometime I don't care about anonymity, I care about spamming.

This is not "pick one of two". You can switch.

If you care about anonymity, you can use the ID provider that allow multiple accounts.
If you care about spamming, you can use the ID provider that anti multiple accounts.

If someone wants to use DRM, then they are welcome to write their own proprietary applications, and make users jump through the extra hoop of getting them and installing them.
It is harmful to the very concept of an open standard to **include proprietary technology in an open standard**.

11_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body:
ZeroNet still have some issues, and commercial products is good enough (but privacy).
For example, ZeroNet have **no trust timestamp** and have **large delay (more than 30 seconds)**.

ZeroNet is not good for IM, try these: [Tox](https://tox.chat), [Matrix](https://matrix.org)

---

Telegram is [weak](http://cs.au.dk/~jakjak/master-thesis.pdf), enjoy at your own risk.

1_141zS75MupoDVjN4p7ivG9pXUXjAm9jLBQ.body:
1. ZeroFrame is not required, visit site directory, publish by `zeronet.py siteSign` command-line, query by ` .db` files.
Have your own client is possible, in any language, any platform.

2. You can compile [ZeroFrame](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroTalk/blob/master/js/utils/ZeroFrame.coffee) to WebAssembly.
ZeroNet have no limit, do it yourself.

OK, but I mean: one username **in one provider** have multi identity address

Example:
12UVDkhXyM7yx2saWort93bimDJSeHPGG3 = polar@kaffie.bit
1PZkvcGfvmQ7vfDQGuP3ukVrQRUpm5Pmr5 = polar@kaffie.bit
16Pq7o2JS5jP1MGk7iQVRV2r5wnhw7Bgyp = polar@kaffie.bit

> [prudence](#comment_4_1Cy1dDBGdk9AE6c2HbU97yXpxB29t1D16j): How do they get multiple addresses? Is that from using the same id on multiple ZeroNet nodes?

No, not the multiple nodes. When sign username to address, some ID provider **don't check** whether the username is exist.

So any way to set `permission_rules` and `permission` the to address, not username?

the post that: [the post author is target user's followee] AND [the post @mention target user]

@mention is enough do this.

1513607828_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_84_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Git!

I need the built-in feature. And git is low-performance for **HUGE** amount of files.

A great example: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Lainchan

> One lainon summed up the events very nicely: "Appleman didn't bother to change credentials on the server's control panel so when he requested a password reset Kalyx got the email instead of him. Realizing he had access to the server's control panel, Kalyx decided to be a dick and erase the server entirely, thinking appleman could just restore it from back ups. Appleman in a remarkable feat of stupidity kept lainchan's back ups on the same server it was hosted on, so those got nuked at the same time as the rest of the site."

Since site owner have the all power to nuke all files AND almost all user have no backup, it is important for it built-in file history.

> [gitcenter](#comment_86_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): GitHub owners can erase all data, too. Do you know a service which has no problems?

But we have clone, right?

> [gitcenter](#comment_92_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Which one?

Normal git.
If a git repo erase all data and push to remote server, we still have local copy.

> [gitcenter](#comment_93_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What stops you from using Git for ZeroNet?

No, I can use git on my site. But I want apply this feature on all site.

> [gitcenter](#comment_98_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): So you basically want a backup system?

Yes.

> [gitcenter](#comment_99_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): cron?

I don't use time-based job scheduler. Full-scan / full-copy all file in `/data` is low-performance.
I monitor file change: when file change, I copy the changed file to mirror folder, and mirror folder stored all old version of files since I start seeding)

But I ~~can~~ can't get the history data before I seeding, other peers can't easily read my mirror.

15_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ.body:
Migrate data, not migrate application. Application should be rewrite to designed for ZeroNet (since ZeroBlog, ZeroTalk, ZeroMe is existed, maybe you have not to rewrite)
Read data, generate `data.json` for each user, and publish these to `SITE_ADDRESS/data/users/USER_ADDRESS`.

If original user want to control its data, there is 2 method:
1. site owner run a proxy, user sign into original site + request to change some file, site owner apply change + publish to ZeroNet (use site owner's key)
2. site owner run an id server, user sign into original site + request id, site owner give user cert (user current address should be same as `SITE_ADDRESS/data/users/USER_ADDRESS`)

> [p2p](#comment_320_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): Another thing worthy considering: what if import existing discourse forum to ZeroNet? Extremely difficult if no porting because of the huge difference of structure.

1. Your plan is OK in theoretical, but **impossible in engineering**. Your plan is far more difficult than rewrite application.

2. Your plan is required an append-only log system, but ZeroNet is only have file system. You need care about dat protocol.

3. Migrate data (my plan) is more easier than your think.

> [p2p](#comment_323_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): writing application may be easy but tweaking for good user experience is not easy. Mature applications are already tweaked for years. [...]

You can reuse mature front-end code, but back-end code have to be rewrite.
More: [Advanced Usage: Immutable Content, Trusted Timestamp, Permission Control - ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1509875191_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6)

> [p2p](#comment_324_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): many apps' front-end code and back-end code are not easily separated.

Unfortunately need to rewrite all.

> [p2p](#comment_326_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): years and years before it becomes mature.

If a website is not separate front-end and back-end, don't call it mature.
And, write ZeroNet back-end code is really easily, you don't need to care about high-availability, it is default high-available.

1516151246_1Mr2r33XUTykaCR9yXLhqdkx2DaNa.body: If I understand correctly: you use I2P tunnel as proxy, not use I2P internal torrent?

> [kanotix2](#comment_14_1Mr2r33XUTykaCR9yXLhqdkx2DaNa9EALD): and yes its creates tunnels with private key public pair how like tor....internal torrent? without the tunnels its not possible to make a connection to i2p....

1. clearnet tracker + I2P-peer to clearnet-peer torrent (use I2P as proxy to connect clearnet)
2. I2P built-in DHT + I2P-peer to I2P-peer torrent (internal torrent)

If I understand correctly, [1] is true, [2] is false, because of *its needed that you activate the i2P Bob Bridge and the I2P HTTP/HTTPS Proxy in your router*.
